Articles.Content: he guys I want to know if ksp updates automatically updates on PC or not and if it doesn't how to update?

If you have the Steam version it will update automatically - whether you want it to or not. If you got it directly from KSP go to kerbalspaceprogram.com, click on 'Store' and log in from there.

Edited January 26, 2018 by Ty Tan Tu

4 hours ago, Ty Tan Tu said:

If you have the Steam version it will update automatically

Yup.  And Steam will (often enough) clean out your Steam/KSP directory including vaporizing all your craft and saved games.  Gone.  Poof!

So, advice is to take the Steam root directory for KSP(*) and copy it elsewhere and launch KSP from there.  When Steam updates your KSP version, just copy it again into your safe place and then merge your files into it.

I have Steam running in one place, but everything stored in a separate ./games/KSP directory and under that I have subdirectories 1.3.1.1891, 1.2.1.1604 and 1.0.5.1028.  So I can run KSP versions, side-by-side.  (I also have all my stuff under git control with a master repository.  )

* on Linux: ~/.steam/steam/steamapps/common/Kerbal Space Program  If you're on some other system, look for a steamapps under App Data or look at Properties on your KSP short-cut...

on the flip side if your someone like me who has a bunch of mods and too lazy to update them all and rather run the old version and never have steam update it

open steam

go to game and right click

select properties

find beta tab

select which version to run
^--- Disclaimer: only a small subset of past versions is available on Steam.

11 hours ago, Ty Tan Tu said:

If you have the Steam version it will update automatically - whether you want it to or not.

Turn off auto updates. If a new release drops it will prompt you to upgrade. If you're not ready to yet, either pin to the previous release in the properties or don't launch the game through Steam.
